image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man identified by a crooked crowbar and a home CCTV system he installed is convicted of aggravated burglary for breaking into and robbing two cafes in one night.

title.children: Canberra burglar undone by own CCTV system and a crooked crowbar

image.altText: A drone shot of green pastures

props.synopsis: Once used for agricultural research, the development of the CSIRO Ginninderra Experiment Station, a 701-hectare area of land between Belconnen and the Barton Highway, was first floated a decade ago.

title.children: 'Deeply frustrating': Calls to end three-year delay on CSIRO land sale

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Former childcare educators are revealing serious incidents at Affinity Education's Canberra centres, including a case of a baby rolling off a change table.

title.children: 'Toxic': Former Affinity childcare staff say baby fell off change table

image.altText: A myrtle rust infection visible as yellow dots on a green branch.

props.synopsis: Myrtle rust is a bright yellow-looking fungus originally from South America, infecting plants in the eucalypt family with sometimes devastating effect.

title.children: 'Quite worrying': Myrtle rust detected at National Museum of Australia

image.altText: Australian Olympic and world championship bronze medallist Dean Hewitt, practising his delivery of the stone from the hack

props.synopsis: Olympian Dean Hewitt wants to inspire the next generation of curlers in Australia but a lack of purpose-built facilities is stifling high-performance growth in the sport.

title.children: Curling legacy on thin ice as wait continues for purpose-built arena

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court (good generic). (22 April 2016)

props.synopsis: A 29-year-old man has been sentenced to more than nine years in jail after he admitted to drugging two people and sexually assaulting them.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for drugging, sexually assaulting, filming two people

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and a green tie alongside a woman in a green jumper

props.synopsis: A Canberra jury finds Hakan Eren not guilty of seven charges, including rape. The allegations first arose following a Bumble date in 2022.

title.children: Canberra man found not guilty of raping woman he met on Bumble

image.altText: A group of sheep eating hay.

props.synopsis: Autumn rainfall in the Canberra region is well below average, forcing some farmers to sell stock. A climatologist says the capital is also on track for its hottest May on record.

title.children: For sheep farmer Tony, current dry conditions are worse than the last big drought

image.altText: A person in a flouro jacket and a rescue worker carrying two dogs under his arms walk in floodwaters.

props.synopsis: Residents of the NSW Mid North Coast are rallying together as record flooding strikes the region, leaving five dead and more than 6,000 without power. These pictures capture the impact.

title.children: In pictures: The devastating impact of the Mid North Coast floods

image.altText: A young Essendon player roars with delight as he runs back after kicking a goal at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Essendon plays Richmond in 'Dreamtime at the G' as an unlikely hero gives the Bombers the advantage. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Magic debut for Clarke with three in a half for Bombers at MCG

image.altText: Junior Paulo of the Eels going through stretches before an NRL match

props.synopsis: Junior Paulo has celebrated his milestone 250th NRL match with victory as Parramatta down Manly 30-10. Follow live.

title.children: Eels lift for milestone man to sink Sea Eagles by 20 points

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: Parramatta Eels 30 def. Manly Sea Eagles 10
61' TRY: Hopgood scores for the Eels

image.altText: A dingo on K'gari (Fraser Island) on December 18.

props.synopsis: The Queensland Ambulance Service said the boy was bitten on his underarm just before noon and rushed off the island for medical treatment.

title.children: 'All in efforts to save the child': Dingo stabbed on K'gari after biting boy

image.altText: An australian aboriginal woman wearing a beige jacket and black shirt stares into the sky, with banana leaves behind her

props.synopsis: Mardudhunera woman Raelene Cooper files a last-minute application in the Federal Court to halt Woodside's North West Shelf gas project as it awaits final approval.

title.children: Traditional owner launches legal challenge to stall major gas project

image.altText: Screenshot of alleged assault of Chinese migrant

props.synopsis: Two 12-year-old girls have been charged with assault and granted conditional bail after allegedly attacking a Chinese woman and her husband in a Sydney park.

title.children: 'Life here is not safe': Victim speaks of alleged racial assault in Sydney

image.altText: A blond man wearing a rainbow flag around his neck smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Josh Dolega was up against the secretary of Unions Tasmania, the party's former state secretary, and a local councillor to fill the Senate vacancy. The lowest profile of the group, he's now been confirmed.

title.children: Labor selects low-profile union official as new Tasmanian senator

image.altText: a large rough diamond being held by a hand.

props.synopsis: Australia's diamond industry future is described as "a long shot" as the Perth-based company behind the Northern Territory's Merlin diamond mine goes into administration.

title.children: Diamond mining company goes into administration

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: New Zealand is opening a series of charter schools and giving them "considerable flexibility" when it comes to the curriculum, but education scholars point to the US as they warn against the policy.

title.children: Australia hates them. So why are NZ and the US keen on charter schools?

image.altText: A woman with a flower fascinator hugging her taller daugher

props.synopsis: The mother of missing Bundaberg teenager Pheobe Bishop says the "numbness" the family is feeling is "eating at us", as police and a dive squad expand the search to bushland.

title.children: Police and dive squad scour national park for missing teen

image.altText: The inside of a dark tunnel with equipment.

props.synopsis: The Australian Workers Union says it is looking at legal action over claims Snowy 2.0 workers were locked down during this week's strike action.

title.children: Union considering legal action as further Snowy 2.0 strikes loom

image.altText: A graphic showing the two logos of the companies, one of which has scratches on it, imposed ontop of a textured grey background

props.synopsis: The mother of a man who headed a disability housing provider that entered liquidation days after an NDIS participant died, has been able to start a near-identical business on the same premises.

title.children: Mother starts near-identical NDIS business after son's company liquidated

image.altText: William Tyrrell in red shirt, sitting in chair with drink

props.synopsis: The woman, who cannot be identified for legal reasons, successfully appealed her conviction for two counts of assault and two counts of intimidation against the different child.

title.children: William Tyrrell's former foster mother has conviction overturned over different child

image.altText: An angry-looking Meghann Fahy sits on the steps of a grand-looking house holding a basket of fruit.

props.synopsis: Meghann Fahy and Milly Alcock are two estranged sisters split down class lines in the latest drama from Netflix offering schadenfreude as a balm for cost-of-living anxieties.

title.children: As cost-of-living anxieties increase, the latest eat-the-rich drama is here

image.altText: Image of man with serious face and black shirt

props.synopsis: A reality TV personality, who was a topless waiter at a 60th birthday celebration, was being a "good Samaritan" when he was stabbed while protecting a woman at the event, a court has heard.

title.children: Reality TV star stabbed at 60th party was protecting woman, court hears

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and blue jeans wearing a One Nation branded cap walks into court

props.synopsis: A court considering an application by a Victorian MP and her husband for a personal safety order against a One Nation backer has heard the MP's husband shoved the supporter at a car show in regional Victoria.

title.children: MP's husband, One Nation voter in 'push and shove', court hears

image.altText: A young man in a green shirt wearing sunglasses leaving a courthouse

props.synopsis: Sunshine Coast man Simon Barra Yaite is facing eight sexual assault charges for allegedly groping and filming women while they were out exercising alone or at work.

title.children: Man who allegedly filmed groping of women exercising refused bail

image.altText: Close up of Anohni's face, she has blonde hair and purple eye shadow

props.synopsis: Whenever Anohni brings her powerful and beautiful voice to Australia, she wants to use it for good.

title.children: Why this artist will never bring her band to Australia again

image.altText: Three people work intently around rocks.

props.synopsis: The latest findings from a study of the impacts of industrial air emissions on rock art in WA's Pilbara suggests rocks located closer to industry are more degraded than those further away.

title.children: Industrial emissions have impacted ancient Pilbara rock art, report suggests

image.altText: The Alfresco Community Kitchen

props.synopsis: Alfresco Community Kitchen were informed by City of Sydney council via email on Monday they wouldn't be able to serve at their usual location during the time of the festival.

title.children: Food charity forced to move from CBD spot because of Vivid Sydney

image.altText: hepburn shire council

props.synopsis: Ratepayers in Hepburn Shire, home to spa tourist town Daylesford, are outraged with a rates increase to tackle debt.

title.children: Hepburn council sparks outrage by increasing rates by 10pc

image.altText: A man in a suit looks on, surrounded by flowers.

props.synopsis: A display of Australian Great Sun Orchids at London's Chelsea Flower Show is awarded a gold medal by the Royal Horticultural Society's notoriously strict judging team.

title.children: Aussie orchid turns heads with gold at world's most prestigious flower show

image.altText: A woman with short greying hair wearing a green patterned shirt gazing to the right with her face tilted upwards

props.synopsis: Theory & Practice, Michelle de Kretser's novel exploring the "messy gap" between art and life, has won one of the nation's top literary awards.

title.children: Third time lucky for Australian author, winner of the $60k Stella Prize

image.altText: Dark hair man in suit wearing sunglasses and yellow tie

props.synopsis: A former Illawarra schoolteacher and footballer has been acquitted of sexually touching a child.

title.children: Jury finds ex-NRL player not guilty of sexually touching young girl

image.altText: JJ holding the Eurovision trophy while singing as confetti flutters down

props.synopsis: From Eurovision to the Europa League and a Liberal-National break-up in between, this week was a big one on the news front. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An historic break-up, Sydney's train pain and the Eurovision final
